structuralIssues.englishText: You don't have to pay (a poll tax) to vote

structuralIssues.englishText: Any citizen can vote. (Women and men can vote.)

translationIssues.text: Donald J. Trump
JD Vance
(As of July 2025)
The Vice President succeeds to the presidency if the President can no longer serve.
The Speaker of the House is third in the line of presidential succession.
The President holds the ultimate authority over the U.S. armed forces as Commander in Chief.
A bill passed by Congress must be signed by the President to become law.
The President has the power to veto bills passed by Congress.
What does the President’s Cabinet do?
advises the President
The Cabinet, composed of the heads of executive departments, provides expert advice to the President.
Secretary of State
The Secretary of State is a key cabinet member responsible for foreign policy.
Secretary of the Treasury
The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for the nation's financial and economic policy.
Secretary of Defense
The Secretary of Defense oversees military and defense policy.
Attorney General
The Attorney General is the head of the Department of Justice and the chief law enforcement officer.
reviews laws
